p: The rapid development of ARDS in patients diagnosed with COVID-19 may not be primarily due to SARS-CoV-2 per se but the cytokine storm [ 58]. Interleukin (IL)-6 is one of the most important pro-inflammatory cytokines [ 58]. Hence, specific blockade of the IL-6-regulated signaling pathways represents a promising approach to attenuate inflammation-associated damage [ 59]. Tocilizumab is an antihuman interleukin 6 (IL-6) receptor monoclonal antibody approved for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis [ 60, 61]. In a recently published study of 15 patients with COVID-19, tocilizumab combined with methylprednisolone ameliorated increased CRP and IL-6, but the result was insufficient to support its therapeutic effects [ 62]. Upon the recently launched randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled phase III clinical trial called COVACTA, the safety and efficacy of intravenous tocilizumab in hospitalized adult patients with severe COVID-19 pneumonia will be compared with placebo in addition to the standard of care [ 63].
